samples.question: Do you think it is important to make plans before doing something?
samples.transcript: >> for me you know setting plans before doing anything especially when you really need to attain something really important like a goal or something.
samples.transcript_original: >> Uh for me you know setting plans before doing anything especially when you really need to attain something really important like a goal or something.
samples.transcript_cleaned: >> for me you know setting plans before doing anything especially when you really need to attain something really important like a goal or something.

samples.question: I think it is really crucial for you know for all of us because a plan is like a set of guidelines or instructions which not only help you stay on top of everything but you know but it also helps you kind of put the right energy the right effort into the right task instead of just doing everything without any directions and you know moreover it also kind of helps us maintain our discipline because you A plan will all will always have a timeline, right?
samples.transcript: So if we can follow the timeline perfectly, I think we will become a more, you know, a better version of of ourselves, especially in terms of, you know, time management skills. >> Okay.
samples.transcript_original: So if we can follow the timeline perfectly, I think we will become a more, you know, a better version of of ourselves, especially in terms of, you know, time management skills. >> Okay.
samples.transcript_cleaned: if we can follow the timeline perfectly, I think we will become a more, you know, a better version of of ourselves, especially in terms of, you know, time management skills. >>

samples.question: What are the advantages of making plans with other people?
samples.transcript: Well, I think the most obvious advantage when you, you know, adjust your own plans to match other people's needs is that you will you gain reciprocity with them. I mean it is really hard to put it, but maybe for example, if you alter your plans to help a person, you know, so basically you guys can just coordinate with each other better. And of course, not only can you help that guy or that girl, but you know, but also you can receive their help, you know, in return. So, basically, it kind of creates a win-win situation.
samples.transcript_original: Well, I think the most obvious advantage when you, you know, adjust your own plans to match other people's needs is that you will uh you gain reciprocity with them. Uh I mean it's really hard to put it, but maybe for example, if you uh alter your plans to help a person, you know, uh so basically you guys can just uh coordinate with each other better. And of course, not only can you help that guy or that girl, but you know, but also you can receive their help, you know, in return. So, basically, uh, it kind of creates a win-win situation.
samples.transcript_cleaned: I think the most obvious advantage when you, you know, adjust your own plans to match other people's needs is that you will you gain reciprocity with them. I mean it is really hard to put it, but maybe for example, if you alter your plans to help a person, you know, so basically you guys can just coordinate with each other better. And of course, not only can you help that guy or that girl, but you know, but also you can receive their help, you know, in return. So, basically, it kind of creates a win-win situation.

samples.question: >> Why do some people dislike following a plan?
samples.transcript: >> Technically, there are many cases when, you know, we see so many people who are not fond of following a plan. and I think it all comes down to their in I like their personality because if a person who is inherently adventurous I think they would really they would just embrace the risk and they just love enjoy the an adrenaline rush when they face or encounter any kinds of problems. on the other hand maybe the reason behind those who really like following plans is that they prefer stability so they just do not want to change anything. >> Okay.
samples.transcript_original: >> Technically, there are many cases when, you know, we see um, so many people who are not fond of following a plan. Uh and I think it all comes down to their in I like their personality because if a person who is inherently adventurous uh I think they would really they would just embrace the risk and they just love uh enjoy the an adrenaline rush when they face or encounter any kinds of problems. Um on the other hand maybe the reason behind those who really like following plans is that they prefer stability so they just don't want to change anything. >> Okay.
samples.transcript_cleaned: >> Technically, there are many cases when, you know, we see so many people who are not fond of following a plan. and I think it all comes down to their in I like their personality because if a person who is inherently adventurous I think they would really they would just embrace the risk and they just love enjoy the an adrenaline rush when they face or encounter any kinds of problems. on the other hand maybe the reason behind those who really like following plans is that they prefer stability so they just do not want to change anything. >>

samples.question: Do you think young people and older people plan things differently?
samples.transcript: I think the main you know distinctions between how younger generations and older generations plan for their own things is that you know the first one is probably about the you know about the goals that they set. when it comes to the younger generations their goals might be you know much more much in the short term not really in the long term like the other generations. and those goals are usually more materialistic compared to the to the older generations. And maybe the second distinction probably you know in terms of the practicality of the goals and also the ability to you know cope with some variables in the you know during the process of do doing that plan. because older generations tend to have an enrich knowledge and experiences since they have encountered many things in their life. So they they will be more thoughtful in terms of planning and of course they will have they will come up with several solutions for you know for pro problems which can incur during the process. on the other hand you know the younger generations might not be so ready for you know problems and they I think they are more prone to variables when they kind of occur.

Um and those goals are usually more materialistic compared to the to the older generations. So they they will be more thoughtful in terms of planning and of course they will have they will come up with several solutions for you know for pro problems which can incur uh during the process. Uh on the other hand you know the younger generations might not be uh so ready for you know problems and they I think they're more prone to variables when they kind of occur.

And maybe the second distinction probably you know in terms of the practicality of the goals and also the ability to you know cope with some variables in the you know during the process of do doing that plan. because older generations tend to have an enrich knowledge and experiences since they have encountered many things in their life. samples.question: Is it better to make detailed plans or just be flexible?
samples.transcript: As I mentioned in some of the previous questions, I think it all comes down to like a person's personality because if a person is really really adventurous or they really like to risk everything, I think they would prefer being you know flexible because those people are they have already been adaptable and resourceful enough to you know to cope with any changes in their in their own life. So I think they will be you know they will be better if they can just work things on their own without any plans. However, for those who would like stability and you know they are more prone to changes I think making a detailed plan before responding to you know to things in their life will be a better solution.
samples.transcript_original: As I mentioned uh in some of the previous questions, I think it all comes down to like a person's personality because if a person is really really adventurous or they really like to risk everything, I think they would prefer being you know flexible because those people are they have already been adaptable and resourceful enough to you know to cope with any changes in their in their own life. So I think they will be you know they will be better if they can just uh work things on their own without any plans. However, for those who would like stability and you know they are more prone to changes I think uh making a detailed plan before responding to you know to things in their life will be a better solution.
samples.transcript_cleaned: As I mentioned in some of the previous questions, I think it all comes down to like a person's personality because if a person is really really adventurous or they really like to risk everything, I think they would prefer being you know flexible because those people are they have already been adaptable and resourceful enough to you know to cope with any changes in their in their own life. So I think they will be you know they will be better if they can just work things on their own without any plans. However, for those who would like stability and you know they are more prone to changes I think making a detailed plan before responding to you know to things in their life will be a better solution.

samples.question: She gives the short form, right?
samples.transcript: She gives the duration around 6 years or whatever it was. She gives the short duration and then she goes into passive. I started back in. And this is a very natural way of dealing with the question.
samples.transcript_original: She gives the duration around 6 years or whatever it was. She gives the short duration and then she goes into passive. I started back in. And this is a very natural way of dealing with the question.

samples.question: How long have you been living in this house?
samples.transcript: I have been living in this house. We have this reflected mirroring question in one tense. answer in one tense. But when we talk about flexibility, it is a really natural way of answering this, giving the short form and then changing the tense around a little bit. yeah, very natural. >> And it was something like fun. >> Notice the dropping of the T. It was something like fun. So, I do not know how much Arena thinks of this, but when we have something like it was, we have the T, which is a consonant sound, T, and then we have the W, which is also a consonant sound. And so, saying it was, there is nothing wrong with saying it was, but very often in connected speech, we will see that T disappear. It was, it was, and the T becomes something called a glottle stop. You know, everyone knows this bottle of water. bottle of water.

Um yeah, very natural. >> And it was something like fun. >> Notice the dropping of the T. It was something like fun. So, I don't know how much Arena thinks of this, but when we have something like it was, we have the T, which is a consonant sound, T, and then we have the W, which is also a consonant sound. And so, saying it was, there's nothing wrong with saying it was, but very often in connected speech, we will see that T disappear. It was, it was, and the T becomes something called a glottle stop. You know, everyone knows this bottle of water. Ah, bottle of water.

And so, saying it was, there is nothing wrong with saying it was, but very often in connected speech, we will see that T disappear. It was, it was, and the T becomes something called a glottle stop. You know, everyone knows this bottle of water. bottle of water.

samples.question: You might think, well, that is not like that is not C1C2 language, is it?
samples.transcript: She brought me up as a single parent. It absolutely is. it is topic specific. it is appropriate. And that is always what we are looking for, appropriacy. we are not looking for syllables. it is not like, oh yeah, I would say my mom because she was a pseudo anti-isestablishmentarianist. No, she brought me up as a single parent. Amazing. >> yeah, we get along and like >> cool, get along instead of get on. Nice. >> We have the same vibe. samples.question: Now, what are some common situations that require an apology?
samples.transcript: >> If we start from small situations like accidentally hitting a person, >> accidentally hitting a person is fine. bumping into a person maybe bit more natural but hitting accidentally hitting is fine >> or I do not know pushing a person on a crowded train then of course we say sorry if we talk about like bigger mistakes I think there could be some issues with misunderstanding among parents and their children among co-workers or teachers and students >> can we get a list of three things. >> In these situations when there is some misunderstanding, people have to apologize sometimes. >> Yeah. Perhaps, you know, if I am uber critical, I could say, well, give me a detail of that possible misunderstanding.

Perhaps, you know, if I'm uber critical, I could say, well, give me a detail of that possible misunderstanding.
